activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorothy Mayasa Katana

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Dorothy Mayasa Katana.  Attorney Harper on behalf of Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson asks for a date for a plea and sentencing.

Defendant must be here in person at the next hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:14 AM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Dorothy Mayasa Katana.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson states that he has received an offer yesterday; spoken with DK briefly and request more time. DK agree with a set over. Attorney Erickson asks the his client may appear by zoom. Judge McDougal grants DK to appear by zoom at the last hearing and states that this will probably be the last time.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
On the Record
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Dorothy Mayasa Katana. Attorney Forehand states that they have an officer by zoom for the preliminary hearing but Attorney Erickson just received the case. Attorney Erickson asks for a reset and waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing. 

Court speaks about the defendant appearing by zoom at the next hearing. Attorney Forehand doesn't object as long as the case isn't resolved. Court will allow defendant to appear by zoom at the next hearing.

Court will schedule a status as the next hearing knowing that the preliminary hearing hasn't been done. Attorney Forehand states that she believes the case will be resolved before a preliminary hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Judge McDougal approved Attorney Erickson to appear via Zoom due to a + COVID test.

1:19 PM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. DK waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court continues the preliminary hearing so her attorney can appear.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand asks for a set over for the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees to extending the preliminary hearing. Attorney Forehand asks if  MK can get her DL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:36 AM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has receive the complaint. Court reads the complaint.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Clerk of Court office has been informed that DK does qualify for the public defender but will not have an attorney available for 06/22/22.

2:07 PM Defendant Dorothy Mayasa Katana not in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand reads the filed letter and ask for  a reset.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
From UW Health

DK called the COC office at 8:25 AM stating that she was in pain and is going to the hospital. The clerk informed DK that she needed to have the hospital fax a letter. Clerk provided her with the fax number and the public defenders number due to her calling the Madison public defenders office instead of Lancaster.

Appearances: CC Schwarze, Unmonitored DAR, ADA Forehand for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail

no objection.
